channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: House lawmakers force a vote on bill to restore federal workers' bargaining rights
item.description: House lawmakers have collected enough signatures to force a vote on a bill that would nullify President Trump's executive order terminating collective bargaining rights for most federal workers.
item.content:encoded: House lawmakers have collected enough signatures to force a vote on a bill that would nullify President Trump's executive order terminating collective bargaining rights for most federal workers.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: As more Catholic churches close, Philadelphia is trying something new
item.description: The Catholic Church is facing aging congregations, fewer priests and financial strain. In many places, this has meant closing parishes. But in Philadelphia, they're trying something different.
item.content:encoded: The Catholic Church is facing aging congregations, fewer priests and financial strain. In many places, this has meant closing parishes. But in Philadelphia, they're trying something different.
item.dc:creator: Buffy Gorrilla

item.title: Grassroots resistance swells in the wake of the immigration crackdown in Chicago
item.description: Chicago is no longer the main focus of the federal immigration crackdown. For one neighborhood group, the intense enforcement activity was a test of resistance tactics they developed eight years ago.
item.content:encoded: Chicago is no longer the main focus of the federal immigration crackdown. For one neighborhood group, the intense enforcement activity was a test of resistance tactics they developed eight years ago.
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: Making sense of Trump's trade deal announcements — and how they impact the economy
item.description: President Trump has been announcing new trade deals with foreign countries. But these frameworks are NOT binding — leaving businesses with lots of uncertainty.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has been announcing new trade deals with foreign countries. But these frameworks are NOT binding — leaving businesses with lots of uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: The AI industry is booming. Is this massive bubble about to burst?
item.description: Is the trillion-dollar AI investment boom completely irrational? Google head Sundar Pichai thinks so, telling the BBC that there are "elements of irrationality" — yet Wall Street continues to invest.
item.content:encoded: Is the trillion-dollar AI investment boom completely irrational? Google head Sundar Pichai thinks so, telling the BBC that there are "elements of irrationality" — yet Wall Street continues to invest.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: German surfers rally to get their wave back
item.description: German surfers are "bummed" they have lost one of the world's largest inland waves. A city dredging project in Munich made the wave disappear.
item.content:encoded: German surfers are "bummed" they have lost one of the world's largest inland waves. A city dredging project in Munich made the wave disappear.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: The DOJ's case against former FBI Director James Comey looks increasingly shaky
item.description: More cracks emerged in the DOJ's prosecution against former FBI Director James Comey at a hearing WEdnesday.
item.content:encoded: More cracks emerged in the DOJ's prosecution against former FBI Director James Comey at a hearing WEdnesday.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Ultra-processed foods are a threat to public health, scientists say
item.description: Ultra-processed foods are a key driver of chronic disease around the world, and governments need to act now, according to new papers published by an international team of health researchers.
item.content:encoded: Ultra-processed foods are a key driver of chronic disease around the world, and governments need to act now, according to new papers published by an international team of health researchers.
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Military members worry new grooming policy will lead to discrimination
item.description: New military standards for grooming and appearance have some worried about religious and racial discrimination, particularly the guidance that men must be clean shaven.
item.content:encoded: New military standards for grooming and appearance have some worried about religious and racial discrimination, particularly the guidance that men must be clean shaven.
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh

item.title: Malala Yousafzai said she's glad she ignored this advice from her parents
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Malala Yousafzai talks about the advice from her parents she's glad she ignored.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Malala Yousafzai talks about the advice from her parents she's glad she ignored.
